channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Amid Kennedy family drama, Billy Baldwin claims he knows why RFK Jr supports Trump: 'It's now or...'
item.description: Billi Baldwin said after missing the chances in 2006 and 2008, RFK Jr is now desperate to fulfil his presidential dreams and 2024 is a now or never year for him for which he sold his soul and went to bed with "Roger Stone, Mike Flynn, Steve Bannon... and ultimately Trump". Amid a major Kennedy family drama over RFK's decision to support Trump, Baldwin simplified it calling it his 'political cowardice'.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Ukraine's '9/11-like' drone attack on residential building in Russia's Saratov
item.description: Debris from a Ukrainian drone was intercepted by Russian defense systems, causing significant damage to residential buildings in Saratov and Engels. Two people were seriously injured. Emergency services responded swiftly to the areas affected. The attacks highlighted the ongoing conflict since Russia's full-scale invasion began in February 2022. Video footage of the attack is going viral on the internet.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Seven injured in fire at Russia's Omsk oil refinery, production continues
item.description: A fire at Russia's Omsk oil refinery resulted in seven hospitalizations, with one person in serious condition. The refinery, operated by Gazprom Neft, maintained normal operations despite the incident. The blaze affected a major crude distillation unit, although production plans remain on track. The cause of the fire is still unknown, though recent attacks on refineries have raised concerns.

item.title: Furious neighbors want JD Vance to move out. What did he do?
item.description: After the assassination attempt on Donald Trump in Pennsylvania, Secret Service has tightened the security of Trump's running mate JD Vance resulting in a closure of a park at the area where JD stays with his family in Alexandria. Neighbors are at a loss to understand why the park was a security threat for the Ohio senator and that he should move out if he has a security threat in the area itself.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump aides panic as former president only plays golf: 'Has he lost his mojo?'
item.description: Reports earlier suggested that Donald Trump's aides apprehend that the former president is yet to overcome the trauma of the assassination attempt as he was found to be watching and rewatching the clip where the bullet grazed past his ear. Trump campaign insiders said he might be suffering from post traumatic stress disorder and hence doing what he enjoys the best -- golfing. Trump is actually taking baby steps as he held the first outdoor rally a few days ago in North Carolina -- first since the assassination attempt.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Juli Vavilova, mystery woman present with Telegram CEO Pavel Durov during his arrest?
item.description: When Telegram CEO Pavel Durov was arrested in France on Saturday evening, he was not alone. A 24-year-old woman, who identified herself as a crypto coach and a streamer from Dubai, was with him. Speculations are rife that Juli Vavilova, who could be Pavel's girlfriend, actually played a role in his arrest by strategically disclosing Pavel's location on her social media feed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: So this music legend is Prince Harry’s new ‘father-figure’: Reports
item.description: Prince Harry has reportedly formed a close bond with Canadian music producer David Foster, who has become a mentor and father figure to him. Foster and his wife, Katharine McPhee, helped Harry and Meghan Markle settle when they moved to Canada in 2020, and the friendship has continued since their relocation to California.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pavel Durov's controversial life: From 'Russian Zuckerberg' to 'father of 100+ kids', now arrested in France
item.description: Tech entrepreneur Pavel Durov, known for creating VKontakte and Telegram, was arrested in Paris over alleged criminal activities related to Telegram. His legal troubles include accusations of fraud, drug trafficking, and promoting terrorism. Durov's arrest and Telegram's controversial role in global conflicts, such as Russia's war against Ukraine, have raised significant concerns.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump’s Bedminster Golf Club to host January 6 awards Gala on Sept 5: High-stakes fundraiser for riot legal defense
item.description: Trump’s golf club in Bedminster will host a gala on September 5 to raise funds for individuals charged in the January 6 Capitol attack. Prominent invitees include Rudy Giuliani and former Trump advisor Peter Navarro. Trump is listed as an invited speaker but may not attend due to ongoing legal matters. The tickets for the event start at $1,500.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Vivek Ramaswamy’s full-circle moment with tennis legend Andre Agassi: ‘Longest distance is between your mind & heart’
item.description: Vivek Ramaswamy shared an inspiring experience on X, detailing a tennis session with legend Andre Agassi. Once a ball boy for Agassi, Vivek later played as his partner. He quoted Agassi's advice: "The longest distance between two points is that between your mind & your heart. Bend the former to meet the latter."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Boeing staff 'humiliated' after Nasa decides to use Musk's SpaceX for astronaut rescue from ISS: 'Morale is in the toilet'
item.description: NASA's decision to use SpaceX's Crew Dragon to rescue two astronauts from the ISS has caused turmoil at Boeing, which has faced setbacks with its Starliner capsule. Boeing employees feel embarrassed and blame NASA for the situation, while NASA cited safety concerns as the reason for opting for SpaceX's spacecraft for the February 2025 mission.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: How Israel tracked and eliminated Hezbollah's 'ghost' commander Fuad Shukr
item.description: An Israeli airstrike in Beirut killed Hezbollah's military commander, Fuad Shukr, shortly after he was instructed to move to a more vulnerable location. The attack followed a deadly Hezbollah rocket strike on an Israeli town. Hezbollah and Iran have vowed revenge, while Israel remains silent on the incident. Shukr was pivotal in Hezbollah's military strategies and operations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Atlantic ocean adventure takes unexpected turn as whales bump boat: Solo paddler calls it ‘incredible sight, but scary’
item.description: An adventurer paddling solo across the Atlantic from Newfoundland to England encountered a massive pod of long-finned pilot whales. Though initially awestruck by the sight, Tom Waddington grew concerned as the whales bumped his boat. Despite the unnerving experience, he continued his journey after the whales swam away. Experts attribute this to the whales' social nature.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Musk's SpaceX steps in to rescue Nasa astronauts Sunita Williams, Butch Wilmore from ISS despite legal challenges
item.description: SpaceX, headed by Elon Musk, will assist Nasa in the return of astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams from the ISS, who are stuck due to issues with Boeing's Starliner. Despite Musk's legal challenges, including investigations by the NLRB and DOJ, SpaceX's Crew-9 Dragon mission will coordinate with Nasa for their safe return.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump teases debate withdrawal - Is September 10 showdown with Kamala Harris on ABC News in jeopardy?
item.description: Former President Donald Trump cast doubt on his participation in the September 10 debate against Vice President Kamala Harris, questioning ABC News' integrity. Trump's remarks have led to speculation about his withdrawal. Harris has been gaining in national polls, further intensifying the race. The Harris campaign had previously confirmed the debate schedule despite Trump's criticisms.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Robert F Kennedy Jr defends Trump Endorsement amidst family backlash: 'They're troubled by my decisions, but ...'
item.description: Robert F Kennedy Jr defended his endorsement of Donald Trump following backlash from his family. Appearing on Fox News, Kennedy admitted the decision troubled his Democratic-leaning siblings and wife Cheryl Hines. He acknowledged the family's disapproval but stressed the importance of maintaining love and respect despite differing political views.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump’s campaign to target ‘Comrade’ and ‘Border Czar’ Kamala over economy and border security
item.description: Donald Trump planned to focus his presidential campaign on border security and the economy. He believed Kamala Harris was struggling with these issues. Trump was vocal about Harris on social media, especially after her speech at the Democratic National Convention. A recent poll showed Harris leading Trump by 7 points nationally.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Mobile phone services to stay suspended in Pakistan's Karachi
item.description: The Sindh home department suspended cellular services in Karachi, Hyderabad, and several other districts following a violent incident between religious groups in Golimar. This precautionary measure aimed to ensure safety during Chehlum processions and gatherings honoring Hazrat Imam Hussain (RA). The attack left two dead and nine injured, escalating tensions and prompting a significant police presence.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Barron Trump heads to college under watchful eye of Secret Service: ‘The goal is to ...’
item.description: Barron Trump, the youngest child of former President Donald Trump, has begun his college journey in New York under the watchful eye of the Secret Service. Although his exact university remains undisclosed, institutions like NYU and Columbia are speculated.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Larry the cat? Downing Street’s beloved feline, who witnessed tenure of 6 UK PMs, faces his final days
item.description: Larry the cat, Number 10 Downing Street's 'chief mouser,' is nearing his 17th year, prompting officials to draft 'Operation Larry Bridges' for his eventual farewell. Adopted in 2011, Larry has seen six prime ministers and even had famous spats with other feline residents. The plan aims to announce his passing with due respect and dignity.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
